snippet: The United States should stay engaged with Libya despite the killing of Ambassador Stevens and three other Americans.
abstract: Editorial condemns the murder of Ambassador J Christopher Stevens along with three other Americans during an attack on the consulate in Benghazi, Libya; contends that Mitt Romney showed an extraordinary lack of presidential character in deciding to use the murders as an excuse to attack Pres Obama; contends that the United States should remain committed to engagement with Libya despite the atrocity.
lead_paragraph: The United States should stay engaged with Libya despite the killing of Ambassador Stevens and three other Americans.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
